question: Homocysteine is
exp: Homocysteine is a non-proteinogenic alpha- amino acid Homologous to cysteine, differing by an additional methylene bridge (-CH2-) Synthesized from methionine.

question: Which of the following conversion is irreversible
exp: One carbon groups are formed from various sources. Except the formation of methyl-THFA The other one-carbons are interconveible The only way of regeneration of active THFA from methyl-THFA is the methionine synthase reaction.

question: Disulphide bond is seen between-
exp: But the question ask disulphide bond "is seen between" or in other words which two amino acids react to form disulphide bond. Two molecules of Cysteine join together to form Cystine, which has a disulfide bond (see fig). Cysteine cannot form disulfide bond with cystine. So disulphide bond is formed between two Cysteine molecules and not between Cysteine and Cystine

question: Which of the following dietarily non-essential amino acid becomes dietarily essential in patients of homocystinuria?
exp: Cysteine is dietarily not essential since it can be synthesised from the essential amino acid methionine In homocystinuria, methionine to cysteine conversion is affected So,Cysteine becomes essential in diet. Extra edge:- Tyrosine becomes dietarily essential in patients of phenylketonuria.

question: The protein defective in cystinosis is responsible for
exp: The protein defective in cystinosis is Cystinosin CTNS (lysosomal efflux). Clinical features:- Renal Fanconi's syndrome & Renal failure Rickets Photophobia Hypotonia Do not confuse cystinuria and cystinosis. Cystinosis is a lysosomal storage disease due defective transpo of cystine out of lysosomes.
opb: Absorption of cysteine from renal tubules

question: Strength and rigidity in keratin is due to -
exp: Keratin is a protein present in the hair, nails and outer layer of skin. Keratin is almost completely comprised of alpha-helices (secondary structure) Two alpha helix are wound around one another to form super helix. Strength and rigidity in keratin is due to Cysteine because of its ability to form disulphide bonds. Number of disulphide bonds is directly propoional to rigidity of keratin i.e. more the disulphide bonds, harder the keratin.

question: Taurine is synthesized from which amino acid?
exp: Taurine, a major constituent of bile is synthesized from cysteine
